post_text:
Staff Spotlight.....

Jeremy White, Music Teacher
Everyone has a unique life story, but some stories are "unexpected" in the way they take place. One such story involves El Portal Middle School's Jeremy White. Mr. White graduated with the intent of joining the US military as a musician. However, plans changed when he received a scholarship to study music at California State University, Long Beach. After completing his master's degree, Mr. White began a teaching career that eventually led him to EPMS where he is beginning his 6th year as a music instructor.

While traveling with the EPMS band to Disneyland in the spring of 2019, Mr. White connected with the bus driver who was a retired music teacher from the Air National Guard. After a 6-hour discussion on the bus ride and a talk with his wife, Mr. White decided to pursue joining the Army Reserve as a musician.

For more on Mr. White see the September newsletter on our website at: www.escalonusd.org

post_text:
Staff Spotlight.....
Debbie Avila, Teaching Assistant
Debbie Avila has been with Escalon Unified School District for approximately eight years. She has worked at all four of Escalon's elementary schools as well as at El Portal Middle School and is currently at Farmington Elementary. Prior to her service for Escalon schools, Mrs. Avila worked in Modesto City Schools for more than 20 years as a teaching assistant. She spent a portion of that time working with special needs students in special day classes.

Mrs. Avila loves working with students and particularly enjoys the small group setting where she can get to know them better and help them one-on-one with their learning. Like most educators, she likes to experience those 'aha' moments when students suddenly understand something.

post_text:
Happy First Day of Distance Learning!

Perhaps it's not exactly what we were all hoping for, it is with great pride and a big cheer that we are ALL together again today!
Through technology and the hard work of lots of heroes, including our EUSD technology department, our teachers, our curriculum team,
district personnel, administrators, our families, and our boys and girls, we are back and running now!
Please take a minute today to thank a hero, someone who is working hard to keep us all safe and healthy while we stay at home to keep our community well.

post_text:
2020 OUTSTANDING TEACHER OF THE YEAR

Every year, teachers nominate candidates for the Escalon Unified Outstanding Teacher of the Year. The nominations are reviewed by a committee and a teacher is selected and presented with an award at either El Portal’s promotion ceremony or EHS’ graduation ceremony. It is Escalon Unified’s honor to share that Susan Heflin has been chosen as the 2020 Outstanding Teacher of the Year.

Sue has served our students and community at both Dent Elementary and Van Allen Elementary for over 22 years. Comments from her peers include “Sue is constantly looking to better herself as an educator. She seeks out training to attend any chance she can get…” Another teacher shared “Sue has dedicated her career to the students of our district and is a truly amazing educator.” Sue has long advocated for teacher training from the UC Davis Math Project and has been instrumental in working with the district to make it happen.

Sue is an excellent example of a fantastic teacher who makes a huge difference in children’s lives.

Congratulations Sue!!!!!

post_text:
El Portal dates and times for student drop off of textbooks and chromebooks and for pick up of personal items has been scheduled for Wednesday, May 27th and Thursday, May 28th. Please see the time schedule below. To comply with social distancing, we are asking all parents to stay in their vehicles and follow the driving directions of the EPMS staff. All vehicles, to begin, will enter the far west entrance to our horseshoe parking lot in front of the school. To ease the congestion on First Street, we will be staggering appointments as follows for students in grades 6-8:

A - G: 9:00 - 10:00 a.m.
H - N: 10:00 - 11:00 a.m.
O - Z: 11:00 - 12:00 p.m.

We anticipate congestion because of the West and East flow of traffic on First Street and we will have someone there to help with traffic flow. Please bring patience and be mindful that we are doing our best to move cars through this process as fast as possible while keeping you and our staff members safe. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
text:
El Portal dates and times for student drop off of textbooks and chromebooks and for pick up of personal items has been scheduled for Wednesday, May 27th and Thursday, May 28th. Please see the time schedule below. To comply with social distancing, we are asking all parents to stay in their vehicles and follow the driving directions of the EPMS staff. All vehicles, to begin, will enter the far west entrance to our horseshoe parking lot in front of the school. To ease the congestion on First Street, we will be staggering appointments as follows for students in grades 6-8:

A - G: 9:00 - 10:00 a.m.
H - N: 10:00 - 11:00 a.m.
O - Z: 11:00 - 12:00 p.m.

We anticipate congestion because of the West and East flow of traffic on First Street and we will have someone there to help with traffic flow. Please bring patience and be mindful that we are doing our best to move cars through this process as fast as possible while keeping you and our staff members safe. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

post_text:
The Collegeville Extended Learning Program (aka After School Program) in collaboration with the Second Harvest Food Bank organizes "Grocery Day" every other Friday at Collegeville Elementary School. Food for approximately 150 families is sorted and prepared for contactless distribution to those in need of additional nutritional support during these difficult times. The Collegeville team is pleased to be able to provide assistance to both Collegeville and Farmington families.

El programa Después de la escuela de Collegeville en colaboración con el Second Harvest Food Bank organiza el día de abarrotes dos veces al mes en la primaria Collegeville. Comida para aproximadamente 150 familias se prepara de una manera segura para aquellos quienes necesitan ayuda durante este período difícil. El equipo de Collegeville le da placer poder darle ayuda a nuesta comunidad tanto como para las familias de Collegeville como para aquellos de Farmington.

post_text:
Color Fun Run Draws In Hundreds on February 29th...
There were several color stations set up on the EHS campus, including one right at the finish line in case you didn’t get enough color on your way around the course. Young, eager runners step up to the starting line as they await instructions from El Portal Middle School principal Mark Vos, front, and EHS teacher and coach Rick Heflin, at right, who served as the official Color Run starter. Young participants had the right attitude, wearing tutus and sporting their identical shirts that stated “Just Add Color!”

For the full story visit the Escalon Times Website at. www.escalontimes.com

Congratulations Dent Students!
Dent sent 9 projects to the SJCOE STEAM Fair. There were 417 projects completed throughout the county this year. 3 Dent students were recognized in their categories.

Kaia Machado 1st Place 4th-5th Grade Science Project: Weight, Speed, and the Warped Wall
Bradley Potts 1st Place K-3 Grade Science Project: Vital Signs: Exercise and Elevation
Hadley Casazza 2nd Place K-3 Science Project: Germinating Lima Beans at Different Temperatures.

post_text:
Over the weekend, Escalon FFA's Food Science and Technology Team competed at their state finals competition at UC Davis. The purpose of this contest is to promote learning activities in food science and technology related to the food industry.

We would like to offer a HUGE CONGRATULATIONS to Madison Hagglund, Melanie Smith, Benjamin Millard, and Wyatt McCune, as they won 1st place this weekend! Madison Hagglund was 1st High Individual, Melanie Smith was 2nd High Individual, and Benjamin Millard was 5th High Individual. This team is headed to Nationals in Indianapolis in October!!
text:
Over the weekend, Escalon FFA's Food Science and Technology Team competed at their state finals competition at UC Davis. The purpose of this contest is to promote learning activities in food science and technology related to the food industry.

We would like to offer a HUGE CONGRATULATIONS to Madison Hagglund, Melanie Smith, Benjamin Millard, and Wyatt McCune, as they won 1st place this weekend! Madison Hagglund was 1st High Individual, Melanie Smith was 2nd High Individual, and Benjamin Millard was 5th High Individual. This team is headed to Nationals in Indianapolis in October!!

post_text: Dent Elementary School was proud to welcome back to The Land of the Dragons, Mr. Kevin Bracy. Mr. Bracy's positive approach in teaching and preaching self motivation, kindness, and embracing yourself and others was enjoyed and appreciated by all students and staff alike. The energy, the chants, and most importantly the message is what will carry us the rest of the school year as we continue to strive to be respectful, responsible, and ready in all phases of life.
text: Dent Elementary School was proud to welcome back to The Land of the Dragons, Mr. Kevin Bracy. Mr. Bracy's positive approach in teaching and preaching self motivation, kindness, and embracing yourself and others was enjoyed and appreciated by all students and staff alike. The energy, the chants, and most importantly the message is what will carry us the rest of the school year as we continue to strive to be respectful, responsible, and ready in all phases of life.

post_text:
Staff Spotlight...April Egusquiza, First Grade Teacher!
Farmington Elementary School is fortunate to have April Egusquiza (pronounced "Egg-us-key-tha" in case you're wondering) as our First grade teacher. April provides her students with a steady course forward through her gentle demeanor, strong organizational skills and many years of experience. April originally hails from Louisiana, which you may pick up on when you hear her slight southern accent. April moved to California in 1997 and to the Escalon area in 2017. She has been teaching for 27 years all within the lower elementary levels (kindergarten to grade 3).
"I love teaching because 180 days out of the year I get to make a difference in someone's life through knowledge, hugs and simple smiles," April said. "I get to show students the exciting world ahead of them, share in the wonderment of their learning today and encourage them to reach for the stars!"
For more on April see the March Newsletter on our website at: www.escalonusd.org

post_text:
Staff Spotlight...Cindy Sipes, MOT Administrative Assistant

Cindy, has been part of the Escalon Unified School District family for over 16 years. Throughout those years, Cindy has served EUSD students in various roles. Cindy was first hired as an Instructional Assistant in 2003. In 2006, Cindy took a position as Dent Librarian where she maintained the school library and encouraged students to grow their love for reading. Currently, Cindy serves as the administrative assistant for the entire Maintenance, Operations and Transportation departments. She is the first point of contact and greets everyone with a smile. She is responsible for assisting the Director of MOT in supporting over 40 plus employees within the department.

For more on Cindy, see the March Newsletter on our website at www.escalonusd.org

post_text:
Casillas Lone Cougar Qualifier For State Wrestling Meet!
A tough weekend saw the season end for the bulk of the Escalon wrestling team, with Julia Casillas the only one moving on from the Masters Meet, headed back to the state tournament.

“The EHS ladies had two girls compete,” said head coach Derek Scott. “Having her career ended after two wild back and forth matches was Kaylee Freeseha. Kaylee had a great year and ended like a champion, with her experience and personal stress she’s had to deal with this year, she did a phenomenal job all season.”

Julia Casillas took the mats for Escalon at 126 pounds and, said Scott, showed “the heart it takes to be a champion.”
Pictured is Escalon’s Bradley Hagglund and Hilmar’s Steven Silva.
For more on this story visit The Escalon Times website at: www.escalontimes.com

New Central Region Officer!
Over the past weekend, the Central Region FFA held its' election for the 2020-2021 Officer Team. The Central Region Officer team is composed of 8 officers, serving over 27,000 FFA members.

Over 50 members applied for this officer team, went through an application and interview process, as well as a speech component.

We are SO proud to say that our own Alayna Azevedo was just elected as the Central Region Secretary for the 2020-2021 school year!

post_text:
Soccer Boys Sting Hilmar In Home Contests...
Starting off the week at Hughson, the varsity soccer boys lost a tough 1-0 decision. They bounced back on Thursday, though, handing Hilmar a setback by the same 1-0 score.
At Hughson, head coach Paul Silva said it was a penalty kick in the 15th minute of the game that proved to be the only score of the night. “Brayan (Barrientos) actually blocked it,” Silva noted of his goalie making the initial PK stop. “But it went right back to the guy and he kicked it in.”
Barrientos had seven saves but Silva said the offense for the Cougars wasn’t clicking and they could never find the net.
“We really couldn’t exploit our speed, we couldn’t get the ball out to the wings and attack,” Silva added. “Credit to Hughson, they really fought and played well. ”Thursday against Hilmar, it was a determined Cougar team that came out looking for victory.
For more on this story visit the Escalon Times website at:
www.escalontimes.com

post_text: Students in Mrs. Anserlian’s AP Spanish class were practicing their interpersonal speaking skill by doing a “Speed dating” activity on Valentine’s Day. Students had two minutes to find out as much information about their “date” as possible before they moved on to the next person. It was a fun way to get students talking and outside to enjoy the nice weather!

Students with year-long perfect attendance will receive a special perfect attendance medal. Pictured here are the medals our Farmington students will receive.

post_text:
Staff Spotlight...Sarah Shank!
Gateway Academy consulting teacher, Sarah Shank has a fondness for sunsets, skiing, family adventures and a passion for life. Those who have worked with Sarah would attest that she brings the same level of energy and passion to the Gateway students and families she has served over the past six years (not to mention the other amazing stuff she did in the classroom the previous 20 years at Dent Elementary). Recognizing the power of collaboration, she has continued to work closely with her previous grade level colleagues, as well as the Gateway staff, in a continual effort to improve her instructional practices and understandings.

For more on Sarah see the February 2020 Newsletter on our website at:
www.escalonusd.org

Trish not only helps our students to grow their love of reading, she also organizes two book fairs a year and develops our annual yearbook.

post_text:
NOTICE!
This morning at approximately 9:45am the El Portal Middle School office staff was notified of a smell that they identified as a potential "gas leak". After a brief assessment, teachers were advised to proceed with evacuation procedures out of all buildings. Escalon Fire Department and PG&E were both contacted. Escalon Fire Department determined there was no concern and it was safe for students to return to class. Students and staff were out of their classes for approximately 15 minutes. All students and staff have resumed normal classroom and scheduled activities.

NOTICE!

After a brief assessment, teachers were advised to proceed with evacuation procedures out of all buildings. Escalon Fire Department and PG&E were both contacted. Escalon Fire Department determined there was no concern and it was safe for students to return to class. Students and staff were out of their classes for approximately 15 minutes. All students and staff have resumed normal classroom and scheduled activities.

post_text:
EUSD's Kristin Tiger
Business Administrator of the Year!
For the 2019 - 2020 school year, the Association of California School Administrators (ACSA) has selected Kristin Tiger as the Business Administrator of the year for our region.The ACSA has 19 regions throughout the state, divided geographically, to provide opportunities for professional development across local school districts.
Nearly 760 educational leaders belong to ACSA Region 7, which encompasses Amador, Calaveras, Tuolumne, San Joaquin and Stanislaus counties.
"We commend Kristin on this outstanding honor and give our thanks for her admirable leadership in our district," said Ron Costa, EUSD Superintendent. The formal award will be presented at the ACSA annual spring conference in early May.
text:
EUSD's Kristin Tiger
Business Administrator of the Year!
For the 2019 - 2020 school year, the Association of California School Administrators (ACSA) has selected Kristin Tiger as the Business Administrator of the year for our region.The ACSA has 19 regions throughout the state, divided geographically, to provide opportunities for professional development across local school districts.
Nearly 760 educational leaders belong to ACSA Region 7, which encompasses Amador, Calaveras, Tuolumne, San Joaquin and Stanislaus counties.
"We commend Kristin on this outstanding honor and give our thanks for her admirable leadership in our district," said Ron Costa, EUSD Superintendent. The formal award will be presented at the ACSA annual spring conference in early May.

post_text: As part of sixth grade Greek Mythology unit, students read "Medusa's Head" myth, acted out "The Hunt for Medusa's Head" play, and watched "Medusa: My Side of the Story" film. These three sources gave students a glimpse of various perspectives on the story of Medusa. The students greatly enjoyed preparing and acting out the play. All students participated by either playing a role in the play or creating props for the play.
